title: Delhi CM Atishi launches crowdfunding campaign, says need ₹40 lakh to fight election - Hindustan Times
summary:
Delhi CM Atishi Launches Crowdfunding Campaign for Election

Publication Date: January 12, 2025
Source: Hindustan Times

Atishi, the Chief Minister and Aam Aadmi Party candidate for the Kalkaji seat, has initiated a crowdfunding campaign to raise ₹40 lakh for the upcoming Delhi Assembly elections. She emphasized the importance of public support in her previous political endeavors.

  • Atishi expressed her need for financial assistance to fight the elections.
  • She highlighted the AAP's reliance on small donations from the public.
  • Atishi addressed past support from constituents and urged for continued backing.
  • The Delhi Assembly elections are scheduled for February 5, with votes counting on February 8.
  • The AAP aims for a third consecutive term after winning 67 and 62 seats in the last two elections.
“Over the past 5 years, you've stood by me as an MLA, a minister, and now as the Chief Minister of Delhi. None of this would have been possible without your blessings and support.” - Atishi

The AAP continues its campaign focusing on work and honesty, with previous crowdfunding efforts by its leaders.
newTitle: Delhi CM Atishi Launches Crowdfunding Campaign for Election

ISRO SpaDeX Docking Mission Live Updates: In trial attempt at docking, SpaDeX satellites successfully come 3 meters to each other, says ISRO - The Indian Express
summary:
ISRO SpaDeX Docking Mission Live Updates

Date: April 2023
Source: The Indian Express

The Indian Space Research Organisation (ISRO) has successfully brought its SpaDeX satellites, Chaser and Target, within 3 meters of each other in a recent trial aimed at demonstrating in-space docking technology.

  • The mission, launched on December 30, aims to showcase in-space docking using small spacecraft.
  • If successful, India will join the ranks of the US, Russia, and China in mastering significant space docking technologies.
  • ISRO is being cautious with the docking process, focusing on accuracy over speed due to the mission's complexity.
“Getting it right is more important than getting it done on schedule.” - ISRO representative

This trial demonstrates significant progress in ISRO's ambition to enhance its space exploration capabilities, including future missions to the Moon and the establishment of a space station by 2035.
newTitle: ISRO SpaDeX Docking Mission Reaches 3-Meter Proximity in Trial

title: EAM Jaishankar to represent India at Donald Trump's swearing-in on January 20 - Hindustan Times
summary:
EAM Jaishankar to Attend Trump's Inauguration on January 20

Publication Date: Jan 12, 2025

Source: Hindustan Times

External Affairs Minister S. Jaishankar will represent India at the swearing-in ceremony of President-elect Donald J. Trump as the 47th President of the United States.

  • Jaishankar will engage in meetings with representatives of the incoming administration and other dignitaries.
  • The swearing-in ceremony will occur on January 20 at noon Eastern Time at the Capitol in Washington, D.C.
  • The theme for the inauguration is “Our Enduring Democracy: A Constitutional Promise.”
“On the invitation of the Trump-Vance Inaugural Committee, External Affairs Minister (EAM) Dr S. Jaishankar will represent the Government of India at the Swearing-In Ceremony of President-Elect Donald J Trump as the 47th President of the United States of America,” - Government Statement

The event marks a significant moment in U.S.-India relations and illustrates the diplomatic engagement during a historic inauguration.
newTitle: EAM Jaishankar to Attend Trump's Inauguration on January 20

title: Steve Jobs's wife, set to visit Mahakumbh, gets Hindu name from Niranjani Akhara - Hindustan Times
summary:
Laurene Powell Jobs Receives Hindu Name 'Kamala' Ahead of Mahakumbh Visit

Date: January 12, 2025
Source: Hindustan Times

Laurene Powell Jobs, the widow of Apple co-founder Steve Jobs, visited the Mahakumbh in Prayagraj. During her visit, she received the Hindu name 'Kamala' from Kailashanand Giri Maharaj of Niranjani Akhara.

  • Laurene is in India to attend the ongoing Mahakumbh ceremony.
  • She visited the Kashi Vishwanath Temple accompanied by Kailashanand Giri Maharaj.
  • The seer expressed that Laurene is seen as a daughter by the Akhara and mentioned her intent to meditate during her visit.
  • Discussions are ongoing about Laurene possibly joining the Akhara's 'Peshwai'.
"She is coming to visit her guru here. We have named her Kamala and she is like a daughter to us." - Kailashanand Giri Maharaj

Overall, her visit is seen as a personal journey of spirituality and learning about Hindu traditions.
newTitle: Laurene Powell Jobs Receives Hindu Name 'Kamala' Ahead of Mahakumbh Visit

title: Centre vs DMK Over Scrapped Rail Project, AIADMK Adds A "Personal" Angle - NDTV
summary:
Centre vs DMK Over Scrapped Rail Project, AIADMK Adds A 'Personal' Angle

Date: Not specified, Source: NDTV

A scrapped railway project in Tamil Nadu is causing a dispute between the state and central governments, with claims and counterclaims regarding the project's status.

  • The DMK disputes Railways Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw's assertion that they did not want the proposed railway connecting Madurai and Thoothukudi.
  • Vaishnaw emphasized the necessity for state support and prioritizing the needs of the public.
  • The DMK accuses the minister of lying and presents evidence of Chief Minister MK Stalin requesting funds for the project.
  • AIADMK alleges that MK Stalin's opposition to the project is based on personal interests related to his sister's constituency.
  • The project, initially announced in 2011, has seen partial completion but is now in limbo due to these political disputes.
“MK Stalin does not want any opportunity for Kanimozhi to take the credit since Tuticorin is her constituency.” - AIADMK spokesperson Kovai Sathyan

This conflict illustrates the ongoing tensions between the DMK-led state government and the BJP-led central government, highlighting the intersection of politics and local infrastructure development.
newTitle: Centre vs DMK Over Scrapped Rail Project, AIADMK Adds A 'Personal' Angle

Maha Kumbh Mela set to welcome 400 million pilgrims—three times the population of Russia - Moneycontrol
summary:
Maha Kumbh Mela set to welcome 400 million pilgrims—three times the population of Russia

Date: January 12, 2025 / Source: Moneycontrol

The Maha Kumbh Mela, also known as the Great Pitcher Festival, is set to begin in Prayagraj on January 13, with over 400 million people expected to participate over the course of six weeks. This makes it the largest human gathering in the world, drawing devotees from across India and around the globe.

  • The event will feature accommodation in 150,000 temporary tents.
  • It is the largest human gathering, expected to attract three times the population of Russia.
  • The Kumbh Mela is a revered Hindu festival held every three years in four sacred cities.
  • Spiritual benefits such as absolution of sins and salvation are believed to be obtained by participants.
“This makes it the largest human gathering in the world.”

The Maha Kumbh Mela is not just a cultural event; it represents a significant spiritual pilgrimage for millions, reaffirming the values and traditions of Hinduism.
newTitle: Maha Kumbh Mela set to welcome 400 million pilgrims—three times the population of Russia

title: ‘Eagerly awaiting my visit to Sonmarg’: PM Modi reacts to Omar Abdullah’s post ahead of Z-Morh tunnel inauguration - Hindustan Times
summary:
PM Modi Eagerly Awaits Z-Morh Tunnel Inauguration in Sonmarg

Date: Jan 12, 2025 - Source: Hindustan Times

Prime Minister Narendra Modi expressed excitement for his visit to Sonmarg, Jammu and Kashmir, for the inauguration of the Z-Morh tunnel on January 13.

  • Modi will visit at 11.45 am and will inaugurate the 6.5-kilometer tunnel.
  • The tunnel aims to provide year-round connectivity between Kashmir and Sonmarg, benefiting tourism and the local economy.
  • Omar Abdullah, the Jammu and Kashmir chief minister, assessed the preparations and highlighted the tunnel's impact on travel times and winter tourism.
  • The project, initiated in 2012, cost ₹24 billion and is crucial for reducing travel disruptions due to heavy snowfall.
“I am eagerly awaiting my visit to Sonmarg, Jammu and Kashmir for the tunnel inauguration. You rightly point out the benefits for tourism and the local economy.” - PM Modi

The Z-Morh tunnel is expected to open on January 13, enhancing access and promoting year-round tourism in Sonmarg.
newTitle: PM Modi Eagerly Awaits Z-Morh Tunnel Inauguration in Sonmarg

Torres fraud: Ukrainian masterminds fled India under garb of Christmas leave - The Indian Express
summary:
Ukrainian Masterminds of Torres Fraud Case Flee Under Christmas Leave Pretense

Publication Date: January 10, 2025 Source: Indian Express

An investigation by the Economic Offences Wing (EOW) of the Mumbai police has uncovered that two suspected Ukrainian masterminds behind the Torres investment fraud case fled India in December 2024 after misleading staff with claims of going on Christmas leave.

  • The suspects, Victoriia Kovalenko and Olena Stoian, are linked to the alleged fraud associated with the Torres jewellery brand.
  • The Mumbai EOW is investigating whether these women were previously involved in a similar fraud scheme in Turkey.
  • Three individuals have been arrested in connection with the Ponzi scheme, including Lakshmi Yadav, who was renting office space for the scheme.
  • A significant amount of money, approximately Rs 5 crore, was seized during searches conducted at multiple locations in Mumbai.
“A heated argument over unpaid salaries at Torres’ Dadar store led to a leak of financial irregularities, prompting around 600 investors to gather outside.”

The events surrounding the fraud have raised significant concerns among investors and authorities alike, highlighting the need for vigilance in investment dealings.
newTitle: Ukrainian Masterminds of Torres Fraud Case Flee Under Christmas Leave Pretense

Latest LIVE: PM Modi attends Viksit Bharat Dialogue 2025 on occasion of National Youth Day - Business Standard
summary:
PM Modi Attends Viksit Bharat Dialogue 2025 on National Youth Day

Date: January 12, 2025 | Source: Business Standard

Prime Minister Narendra Modi attended the Viksit Bharat Young Leaders Dialogue 2025 held at Bharat Mandapam, commemorating National Youth Day in honor of Swami Vivekananda's birth anniversary.

  • Event celebrated the contributions of youth towards nation-building.
  • The Dialogue emphasized visionary leadership and innovative solutions for youth empowerment.
  • PM Modi highlighted the importance of Swami Vivekananda's teachings in inspiring young leaders.
“The youth of our nation are the building blocks of our future; they hold the potential to drive transformative change.”

The event served as a platform to engage young leaders in discussions aimed at fostering growth and development in India.
newTitle: PM Modi Attends Viksit Bharat Dialogue 2025 on National Youth Day

Delhi braces for intense winter chill as IMD predicts rain; fog disrupts flight, train services - The Hindu
summary:
Delhi braces for intense winter chill as IMD predicts rain; fog disrupts flight, train services

Date: January 12, 2025 | Source: The Hindu

Delhi is experiencing a significant cold spell characterized by heavy fog and anticipated rainfall. The Indian Meteorological Department (IMD) has issued warnings and forecasts for further weather disturbances.

  • A blanket of fog caused disruptions in flight and train services.
  • The minimum temperature reported was 12°C, with thunderstorms and hail expected later in the day.
  • 25 trains running late due to fog conditions.
  • Local shelters are providing residents with meals and bedding during the cold snap.
  • Similar weather conditions affecting other North Indian regions, including Kanpur and Gwalior.
"The people who are taking refuge in the night shelters here are being provided with two-time meals and proper bed and blankets." - Vegpal Singh

The severe weather is affecting daily life, prompting appeals for more assistance as residents huddle in shelters and service delays continue.
newTitle: Delhi Prepares for Severe Winter Weather as IMD Forecasts Rain and Fog Disruptions

title: Law student falls from 7th floor during party at friend's Noida apartment, dies - Hindustan Times
summary:
Law Student Falls from 7th Floor During Party at Friend's Noida Apartment, Dies

Date: Jan 12, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

A tragic incident occurred when a law student, identified as Tapas, fell to his death from the seventh floor of a Noida apartment complex during a party at a friend's residence.

  • The incident took place at Supreme Towers in Sector 99, Noida.
  • Police received reports about the fall shortly after the party began.
  • Tapas was an LLB student at a private university in Noida.
  • Authorities are investigating whether the death was accidental or involved foul play.
  • The student's family has been informed, and a post-mortem has been conducted.

Notable Quotes

“Police are conducting a thorough investigation, examining all possible angles in the case.”

Past incidents highlight recurring issues of students falling from high-rise buildings in Noida.
newTitle: Law Student Dies After Falling from 7th Floor During Party in Noida

title: ISRO SpaDex Docking Mission Live Updates: After 2 postponements, satellites likely to attain conditions needed for landmark space docking soon - The Indian Express
summary:
ISRO SpaDex Docking Mission Live Updates

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Indian Express

The Indian Space Research Organisation (ISRO) has conducted a trial attempt with the SpaDeX satellites, bringing them as close as 3 meters in preparation for future docking operations.

  • The SpaDeX mission demonstrates in-space docking using small spacecraft.
  • ISRO aims to join the ranks of the US, Russia, and China in mastering docking technologies.
  • The mission's success may aid future Indian space endeavors, including a potential Moon mission by 2040.
  • ISRO is prioritizing precision over speed in this technology demonstration mission.
“Getting it right is more important than getting it done on schedule.”

ISRO's cautious approach emphasizes the complexity of docking operations in space and the importance of thorough data analysis before any docking attempts.
newTitle: ISRO SpaDex Docking Mission Achieves Significant Milestone
